data.title: Lunch with the wife
data.text: Stopped here for lunch with the wife. Great atmosphere downtown Abilene, great music, tv's for watching sports. Aye a couple of great sandwiches. Super wait staff.

data.title: Nice surprise!
data.text: My husband and I were in Abilene last week and came into Fat Boss's Pub for a late lunch and a beer. The place is huge and well maintained. Even the bathrooms are nice! The menu is varied and creative. The prices are great for food and beer in Abilene! I had the club sandwich - served on a buttered bun and is about 4 inches high! My husband had the chicken fried bacon BLT - served on toasted bread and the bacon is coated in fried chicken batter and fried. AMAZING. I even told the chef! Brianne was our server and she covered the entire restaurant of customers (new and regulars) with the same professional manner. I was so impressed that I will go to Fat Boss's Pub every time I'm in Abilene!

data.title: Lunch on Saturday-ONE server!
data.text: Went for lunch on Saturday July 23rd with 4 friends.  Many tables occupied.  One server also tending bar, chef peered around the corner a few times but offered no help.  We were never acknowledged.  Retrieved our own menus, waited 20 minutes...no one came to the table.  Two 8 tops and at least two 4 tops, including our party, left.  No one there, except other frustrated patrons, spoke to us.  The atmosphere and decor was pleasant and clean.

data.title: Good place!!
data.text: Well I'm FINALLY getting around to reviewing this place!!  I've been on a few occasions and it's one of my favorite places to go out with my pals, have a drink or two, enjoy the fun,and even watch the football on the big screen!!  The waitresses are ALWAYS terrific and everyone here is always pretty friendly!!  They don't have a bunch of drunk losers being a royal pain because they don't tolerate too much crap --- THAT'S a big selling point for me-- ya shouldn't have to worry about irritating drunks bothering you when your out having fun with pals or even by yourself -- I was really surprised the first time I went there, because it was a lot more fun than I'd expected!  But it's definitely one of my favorite places to go!!

data.title: Big Surprise
data.text: We were out late one night and decided to give this place a try after we were told of a good lunch experience someone had. We are very glad that we did. All we had was an appetizer and drink, but it was good enough that we went back the next day for lunch, which was outstanding. I really didn't expect such good food from a bar, but this place pulls it off. We have been back many times. The burgers are good, but some of the other items on their menu are worth trying. Excellent mahi mahi tacos and fish n chips among other things. It can and will get crowded at night, but you should be able to get a table for lunch or an early dinner. It stays family-friendly during the day, but you won't want to bring children here at night.

data.title: My new favorite!
data.text: We've visited on several occasions, on different days, and different times of the day and it is always great! Drink prices are very reasonable, and the food is fantastic!

data.title: Nice Lunch stop downtown
data.text: Really enjoyed the grilled chicken Caesar salad was delicious and big enough to be filling - just right.

data.title: Cool Laidback place
data.text: Cool laidback place for drinks with friends and they will also whip up things on their menu even if its late. Tried the nachos and they were really good. Also if you are into mixed drinks I recommend a California Cocaine...so yummy!

data.title: Nothing Bad, Nothing Great.
data.text:
Some staff - great, other staff - arrogant and condescending. 
Food - Average line cook bar food, one step below true pub fair.
Drinks - decently priced but inconsistent. 
Atmosphere - Poor acoustics, usually you can't hear yourself think. 
Music - Awesome or Not.
Its tough to kill this place and just as tough to call it great.
Sometimes we come and hang all night - other nights we leave before we order anything. Its a strong strong Middle of the Road.

data.title: Cold Beer and Hot & Spicy Wings
data.text: If you are looking for a place in Downtown Abilene to enjoy a meal or a drink...this is the place.  The menu is limited to hamburgers and chicken sandwiches. The burgers come in various sizes, prepared fresh, with a wide selection of toppings.  I enjoyed the Big Boss burger.  My spouse enjoyed shrimp tacos. There is a great selection of draft and bottled beer and a multitude of some very creative mixed drinks.  Try the wings if you like hot and spice, but make sure you have a fresh beer to put the fire out...enjoy!!!

data.title: Nice little downtown spot
data.text: It was a nice little spot for lunch with plenty of seating. The food was pretty good, our service was good, and we didn't feel overcharged for our simple lunch. I will say that I really liked my fish and chips' coleslaw but the chips were actual potato chips (crisps), not fries.

data.title: If you like bar food, this is good fair.
data.text: I took a staff member here for lunch one day and the food was better than I thought it would be, with this being primarily a bar.  We had chicken strips with fries and they were very good.  They also have a large TV screen, so if you wanted to stop by and watch the Cowboys play and have a few drinks with friends, this is a good downtown place to do it.

data.title: Very nice pub, great food and atmosphere.
data.text: Friendly staff, walking distance to the hotel, great food, low prices, great atmosphere.  A really nice place to relax after work

data.title: There is much in Abilene....
data.text: We stumbled upon this place on a visit to Abilene.  It is an old fashioned neighborhood type bar off main street.  They serve bar fare but we only had the salsa (VERY garlicky) and the queso (awful, it tasted like it was made with flour) The drinks were ok and the waitress was helpful with suggestions.

data.title: Good. I'd go again.
data.text: They had a full bar, burgers and appetizers. Saloon feel sort of in a modern way. Good bathrooms. Friendly staff. Queso was awful, salsa was really garlicky. Prices were good. Parking was on a Main Street but wasn't bad on a Saturday early evening. Tables were all 4 tops but you could push them together for larger groups. Very open feel. I'd try it again and pick different food. But it was likable for an Abilene visit. It's no Austin bar, but it was good enough for my business trip liquor needs-

data.title: Great until 9pm
data.text:
Love this place. Friendly staff, and good specials. Its like that perfect spot to meet friends and have a drink.

Wait, lights went down......music is uncomfortably loud........now its packed...... 915....full of younger people.... time to leave.

data.title: Date Night with the Hubby
data.text:
Once again we had the fish and chips. They are soooo gooood !!
The owners need to add more sound damping to the walls but we still enjoy ourselves. Maybe the next time we go I'll order something different but most likely not. Take a friend and go downtown and have fun. This is the place to go with two or twenty.

data.title: Go for drinks and the service.
data.text: Stopped in after eating at nearby Abi Haus. Great customer service and Framboise on tap.  The old building makes for a great atmosphere with ample seating.  Great night club or a nice quiet daytime spot to get a cold one or a cocktail.

data.title: Burnt Offerings
data.text: Ordered a Fat Boss burger. The bun was burned black on both sides. It should never have been plated or taken out to a customer. Will not be back.

data.title: Prom Parents Night
data.text:
After a day of getting kids ready for prom and taking pictures we meet at Fat Bods's Pub for dinner. 
Fish and chips are great. The shrimp tacos are amazing. Wish the building so a little more quite (noise bounces off the walls) but the food and staff will always be worth going back for. Thanks for a fun filled night.
